intro: Lonicera leiantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Lonicera leiantha is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
